channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 26 Viral TikTok Gifts That Are Actually Worth It (2025)
item.description: We’re testing the gadgets that keep showing up in our feeds. Here's what deserves the hype—and would make awesome presents.

item.title: The hottest AI wearables and gadgets you can buy right now
item.description: We compiled all the hottest AI wearables currently available, including Bee, Friend, Plaud, and more.

item.title: The Best Motorola Phones (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Motorola phones may seem old-school, but their reasonable prices, colorful designs, and simple software make them good, wallet-friendly Android smartp...

item.title: SpaceX’s upgraded Starship suffers explosion during testing
item.description: It may not have been a massive fireball, but SpaceX now has more work to do before it can kick off this next-generation version of Starship.

item.title: Google says hackers stole data from 200 companies following Gainsight breach
item.description: Notorious hacking collective Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters takes credit for the breach that affected Salesforce customers’ data, and said it is planning a...

item.title: 11 Best Smartwatches (2025): Apple, Wear OS, Hybrid & Kids’ Watches
item.description: These WIRED-tested wearables reduce your reliance on a phone while keeping you connected.

item.title: Posha vs. Thermomix: Kitchen Robots Face Off on Thanksgiving Sides
item.description: The Posha and the Thermomix TM7 are the closest things to a home robot chef that mere mortals can afford. The catch is that you’re the prep cook.

item.title: CrowdStrike fires ‘suspicious insider’ who passed information to hackers
item.description: Cybersecurity giant CrowdStrike denied it had been hacked following claims from a hacker group, which leaked screenshots from inside CrowdStrike's net...

item.title: X begins rolling out the ‘About this account’ feature to users’ profiles
item.description: The feature will show where users are based, how they're connected to X, and how many times they've changed their username.

item.title: Impersonators are (still) targeting companies with fake TechCrunch outreach
item.description: Fraudsters are impersonating TechCrunch reporters and event leads, and reaching out to companies. Here's what we're doing about it, and what you can l...
